text: Prunus clarofolia () is a species of cherry found in Anhui, Gansu, Guizhou, Hebei, Henan, Hubei, Hunan, Ningxia, Shaanxi, Shanxi, Sichuan, Tibet, Yunnan and Zhejiang provinces of China. A shrubby tree 2.5 to 20m tall, it prefers to grow on mountain slopes between 800 and 3,600m above sea level. As Prunus litigiosa it is called the tassel cherry and sold as an ornamental for its interesting flowers and columnar form.http://powo.science.kew.org/taxon/urn:lsid:ipni.org:names:729591-1 ==References== clarofolia Category:Cherries Category:Endemic flora of China Category:Flora of North-Central China Category:Flora of South-Central China Category:Flora of Southeast China Category:Flora of Tibet Category:Cherry blossom Category:Trees of China Category:Ornamental trees Category:Plants described in 1905
title: Prunus clarofolia
